p.k: Vietnam may be on the move economically but the ‘Communist Manifesto’ still lingers at the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and Lenin Square in the frenzied city of Hanoi. Gordon Sivell takes a sobering look at the prisoner of war camp called the Hanoi-Hilton where American pilots were held in brutal captivity for years. Next, Gordon travels north by train to the border of China to visit the gentle hill tribe people in the market village of SaPa.
